posts.content:
Putting it in here as I'm hoping some of you with fast buses might have a similar set up and can push me in the right direction.

Basically I've got a 2332 that ran 14's in
my bug and it's going into my single cab for next year. It's having a built box fitted but I wasn't sure what lengths of axle/tubes to use?

Any advise or just have you're using would be great.

switch3sixty wrote:Putting it in here as I'm hoping some of you with fast buses might have a similar set up and can push me in the right direction.

Basically I've got a 2332 that ran 14's in
my bug and it's going into my single cab for next year. It's having a built box fitted but I wasn't sure what lengths of axle/tubes to use?

Any advise or just have you're using would be great.


I'm just at the same point and I think that the length for straight axle modified tubes is 555mm. Took the lenghts from the sbs website.

http://www.steeringboxscrapers.net/foru ... =10&t=4361

Look toward the bottom of the page. Hope this helps Nathan

switch3sixty wrote:Putting it in here as I'm hoping some of you with fast buses might have a similar set up and can push me in the right direction.

Basically I've got a 2332 that ran 14's in
my bug and it's going into my single cab for next year. It's having a built box fitted but I wasn't sure what lengths of axle/tubes to use?

Any advise or just have you're using would be great.


Modified axle tubes, (28mm longer than stock) with short end castings on
Late T1 axles (ie post 68) or any T3 axles
you will also need long axles with long splines. So any off a post 68 beelte... you may want to look into race axles as well if you want to pull away in anger with that sort of power in a bus.

Yep, if you really dump the clutch at high'ish rev's, you'll be breaking OG axles.

The weight of the bus, and the extra grip will push them to the limit. Though yours being a pickup, you might get away with it, but I'd fit race axles to be sure.

vwJim wrote:Yep, if you really dump the clutch at high'ish rev's, you'll be breaking OG axles.

The weight of the bus, and the extra grip will push them to the limit. Though yours being a pickup, you might get away with it, but I'd fit race axles to be sure.

get a ferrari if you want to go fast or am i missing something

derkerbusses wrote: or am i missing something



Yup

vwJim wrote:Yep, if you really dump the clutch at high'ish rev's, you'll be breaking OG axles.

The weight of the bus, and the extra grip will push them to the limit. Though yours being a pickup, you might get away with it, but I'd fit race axles to be sure.

get a ferrari if you want to go fast or am i missing something



As Jim said - Yup...

My bus runs a quicker qtr than some ferraris and I can sleep 3 people in comfort too, I know which I'd rather have

Orb

derkerbusses wrote:or am i missing something


Yep !

tufty65 wrote:
derkerbusses wrote:or am i missing something


Yep !

i love my bus standard as i can get out for a p**ss when flat out
must admit on the strip at the pod...top day out...

back to the point............

Yeay big bang 2010 dumped the clutch at 5500rpm and the OG axles just gave up and snapped.

CB performance race axles fitted and no problems at big bang this year
